# docker-compose project-name wrapper
...existing code...
Why use this - Prevent collisions when different projects (anywhere on disk) produce identical Compose project names. - Works without editing each project's compose files.
Usage - Windows PowerShell: - Save to a location in PATH or run from this folder: .\docker-up.ps1 -Path 'C:\path\to\project' up -d - If running inside project folder, omit -Path: .\docker-up.ps1 up -d - Bash: - ./docker-up.sh /path/to/project up -d - Or run inside project dir: ./docker-up.sh up -d
Notes - Prefer removing `container_name:` entries from docker-compose.yml to let Compose namespace resources automatically. - If you can change each repo, add a project-scoped `.env` with `COMPOSE_PROJECT_NAME=unique_name`. - The wrappers compute a unique name as <foldername>_<6-char-hash> derived from absolute path.

param( [string]$Path = (Get-Location).Path, [Parameter(ValueFromRemainingArguments=$true)] [string[]]$Args )
# compute short hash of the full path $sha1 = [System.Security.Cryptography.SHA1]::Create() $bytes = [System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes((Resolve-Path $Path).Path) $hash = [System.BitConverter]::ToString($sha1.ComputeHash($bytes)).Replace('-','').ToLower().Substring(0,6)
# sanitize folder name and build project id $folder = (Get-Item (Resolve-Path $Path)).BaseName -replace '[^a-zA-Z0-9_-]','_' $project = "$folder`_$hash"
# run docker compose with explicit project name cd $Path docker compose -p $project @Args

#!/usr/bin/env bash # Usage: ./docker-up.sh [path] up -d set -euo pipefail
if [[ $# -ge 1 && -d "$1" ]]; then PROJ_PATH="$1"; shift else PROJ_PATH="$PWD" fi
ABS_PATH="$(cd "$PROJ_PATH" && pwd)" HASH="$(printf '%s' "$ABS_PATH" | sha1sum | awk '{print $1}' | cut -c1-6)" FOLDER="$(basename "$ABS_PATH" | sed 's/[^a-zA-Z0-9_-]/_/g')" PROJECT="${FOLDER}_${HASH}"
cd "$ABS_PATH" docker compose -p "$PROJECT" "$@"
